intro: Phragmipedium longifolium f. hartwegii, commonly known as the Hartweg’s long-leaf phragmipedium, is a hybrid orchid native to the cloud forests of Central and South America. It is characterized by its elongated, lance-shaped leaves that can grow up to 30 cm in length. The plant produces striking, fragrant flowers in shades of white, pink, and purple, often with a contrasting lip. It thrives in shaded, humid environments with high air circulation. Due to its ornamental value, it is a popular choice for greenhouse cultivation.
